intro: Caralluma albocastanea, commonly known as the white-barked nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its succulent stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom at night. Its leaves are typically thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native desert environment. Caralluma albocastanea is also known for its alkaloid content, which has been studied for potential medicinal properties.
